title: Green Investing Looks to Clean Up the Maritime Industry
sub_head: Wall Street is embracing a new kind of environmentally friendly debt aimed at lowering ocean pollution
body:
First bonds went green. Now they are going blue.
Seaspan Corp. , the worldâ€™s largest containership lessor by cargo-carrying capacity, sold nearly $1 billion of so-called blue bonds earlier this year that sought to entice new investors by promising to fund vessels that will lower emissions and pollution at sea.
